intro: Heterostigma heudelotianum, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a herbaceous plant characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and distinctive velvety texture. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is native to tropical and subtropical regions. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along streambanks. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and ornamental horticulture.
